title: Insider's Guide to Easton
text: About our Insider's Guide to Easton Mike Hirsch The city of Easton is enjoying a renaissance. New restaurants and bars have created a vibrant scene near Centre Square. Developers have announced plans for apartments that will bring more people downtown. The Easton Farmers Market now lures foodies twice a week, and plans are moving forward for... Hopping through downtown Easton's thriving bar scene Ryan Kneller Because I live in Bethlehem and work in Allentown, I don't get to Easton nearly as much as I'd like. Still, I make it a point to head into the city occasionally for its quaint shops, historic farmers market and outstanding restaurants and bars â€” the latter being my favorite reason to visit. From... Easton biking, running trails offer good workouts Gary R. Blockus The Easton area offers beautiful trails for biking, running or walking. But one thing I learned: For the first time, it's a good idea to go with someone familiar with the trails. The trails provide some beautiful views of the Bushkill Creek and the Lehigh and Delaware rivers. Just don't get fooled... Shopping for antiques and collectibles in downtown Easton Ryan Kneller While some people prefer home furnishings from Ikea, Target and other retail chains, others opt for vintage, repurposed or one-of-a-kind items from antique and collectible stores. In the Lehigh Valley, a prime place to shop for old and out-of-the-ordinary pieces is downtown Easton. From favorites... Easton's family attractions run from Crayola Experience to National Canal Museum Kathy Lauer-Williams From crayons to canals, Easton drew on its manufacturing and transportation history to create terrific attractions and museums. The walls in the following four buildings in Easton would have quite a bit to say about the history of the city, founded in 1752 by Thomas Penn.
